jobs.title: Security Engineer (Lead)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Tin Can

Tin Can is building a safer, simpler way for kids to connect — without smartphones. We’re creating screen-free, delightful devices and services that let families call the people who matter most, free from the noise of today’s digital world.

Parents trust us to keep their kids safe, which makes security not just a requirement, but a core part of our mission. As we continue to grow from a small prototype into a movement reaching families across the country, we’re investing deeply in security as a foundation of trust for every family we serve.

The Role

The Security Engineer will be the guardian of Tin Can’s safety and trust. You’ll define, design, implement, and maintain the systems that protect our infrastructure, devices, and data that families rely on every day.

This is a role for someone who loves solving complex technical problems, anticipates risks before they become issues, and thrives on building a culture of safety across everything we make. You’ll set the security vision while staying close to the code and infrastructure — balancing strategy with hands-on execution.

What You’ll Do

  • Own Tin Can’s security strategy and execution — from policies to implementation.

  • Design and maintain secure cloud systems across our serverless architecture and supporting services.

  • Ensure that our applications are designed and implemented to the highest security and privacy standards, maintaining and enhancing user trust.

  • Identify and mitigate threats across cloud, API, and device layers — everything from misconfigurations to firmware or endpoint risks.

  • Review and analyze designs, architectures, and systems — including services, networks, and applications — from a security perspective through testing, code review, threat modeling, and research.

  • Discover and address emerging security issues, support incident response, and lead forensics, remediation, and cross-functional resolution efforts.

  • Define and enforce access controls, key management, and identity strategies for internal and external services.

  • Establish security standards, incident response plans, and data retention policies that keep our data and systems safe and secure.

  • Partner with Engineering and Product to bake security into every new feature, API, and device lifecycle.

  • Ensure Tin Can remains compliant with regulations and standards (e.g., COPPA, GDPR, SOC 2 down the road).

  • Build team awareness and best practices, helping non-security engineers think securely.

What We’re Looking For

  • 5+ years of experience in security engineering, infrastructure, or related fields.

  • Proven experience securing AWS and serverless environments (IAM, policies, encryption, CI/CD, monitoring).

  • Strong understanding of application, API, and network security principles — particularly for distributed and event-driven systems.

  • Advanced knowledge across multiple disciplines — including web and mobile application security, network security, secure system architecture, encryption, and cloud computing.

  • Familiarity with IoT, MQTT, SIP, or WebRTC security concerns is a major plus.

  • Hands-on experience implementing identity and access controls, token-based authentication, and data encryption.

  • Ability to build from scratch — set up tooling, define processes, and establish secure-by-default patterns.

  • Knowledge of or willingness to work toward compliance frameworks (COPPA, SOC 2, GDPR).

  • A mix of strategic and hands-on — you can write the playbook and the policy.

  • A passion for human-centered security — designing protection that enables connection, not friction.

Why Join Tin Can

  • Mission: We’re on a quest to give kids a more analog childhood—one with real conversations, real connection, and way less screen time. No doomscrolling, data mining, or dopamine traps—just a simpler, better way for kids to stay in touch. At Tin Can, security isn’t a checkbox — it’s how we earn and keep the trust of every family we serve. This is a rare opportunity to build something that truly matters: technology that protects what’s most precious.

  • Impact & Autonomy: This is the dream role for an engineer who wants to fully own building and scaling secure systems from the ground up — with the full backing of the founding team. You’ll have both the autonomy and the responsibility to shape Tin Can’s security vision, tools, and culture as we scale.

  • Collaboration: Every company says “team,” but at Tin Can it means something different. We’re a small, mission-driven group that genuinely has each other’s backs — professionally and personally. You’ll be joining a tight-knit crew where your ideas and instincts matter from day one.

  • Creative Freedom: You’ll have the space to explore new ideas, challenge assumptions, and build secure systems that reflect our values of trust, simplicity, and care.

If you’re driven by the idea of building technology families can trust — and you love the challenge of scaling secure systems that truly matter — we’d love to hear from you.

Tin Can is building a safer, simpler way for kids to connect — without smartphones. We’re creating screen-free, delightful devices and services that let families call the people who matter most, free from the noise of today’s digital world.

This is a role for someone who loves solving complex technical problems, anticipates risks before they become issues, and thrives on building a culture of safety across everything we make. WHY JOIN TIN CAN

 - Mission: We’re on a quest to give kids a more analog childhood—one with real conversations, real connection, and way less screen time. No doomscrolling, data mining, or dopamine traps—just a simpler, better way for kids to stay in touch. At Tin Can, security isn’t a checkbox — it’s how we earn and keep the trust of every family we serve. This is a rare opportunity to build something that truly matters: technology that protects what’s most precious.

 - Impact & Autonomy: This is the dream role for an engineer who wants to fully own building and scaling secure systems from the ground up — with the full backing of the founding team. You’ll have both the autonomy and the responsibility to shape Tin Can’s security vision, tools, and culture as we scale.

 - Collaboration: Every company says “team,” but at Tin Can it means something different. We’re a small, mission-driven group that genuinely has each other’s backs — professionally and personally. You’ll be joining a tight-knit crew where your ideas and instincts matter from day one.

 - Creative Freedom: You’ll have the space to explore new ideas, challenge assumptions, and build secure systems that reflect our values of trust, simplicity, and care.

If you’re driven by the idea of building technology families can trust — and you love the challenge of scaling secure systems that truly matter — we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Social Media Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Tin Can

At Tin Can, we're giving kids the freedom and social independence we had growing up—without smartphones. Our screen-free phone is a remix of the classic landline built for today's world: private, safe, and fun. Parents get peace of mind, kids get autonomy.

Social media is one of the most important ways we share that story. It’s where parents discover us, where families share their experiences, and where our mission turns into a movement. Every post, comment, and campaign is an opportunity to build trust, spark connection, and invite more people into the Tin Can community. As we grow, social media will be a key driver in shaping our brand, amplifying our voice, and helping families everywhere see a more engaged, screen-free future for their kids.

The Role

We’re looking for a Social Media Specialist to take Tin Can’s story to the next level. This is a highly creative and strategic role, working out of our Seattle office four days a week with Friday being optionally remote.

You’ll own the voice of Tin Can across social platforms — building community, shaping our editorial calendar, driving engagement, and helping our mission resonate with parents, kids, and the broader world. This role is equal parts strategy and execution: you’ll be creating, posting, repurposing, and analyzing content while also developing long-term social strategy that ladders up to the brand vision.

You’ll be our day-to-day storyteller on platforms where parents, families, and cultural conversation happen. From launching campaigns to responding thoughtfully to community questions, you’ll make sure Tin Can feels human, approachable, and inspiring everywhere we show up.

If you love connecting with communities, thrive on making content that sparks conversation, and want to help build a generational brand, this is your role.

Key Responsibilities

  • Community Management: Be the daily voice of Tin Can across all social platforms. Monitor conversations, respond to parents and fans, and create an environment where families feel heard, supported, and excited to share their experiences.

  • Editorial Calendar: Develop and manage a robust content calendar that reflects product milestones, cultural moments, seasonal campaigns, and community stories.

  • Content Creation & Posting: Work with creative team to concept, create, curate, and repurpose content (images, video, graphics, copy) tailored to each platform. Ensure content is always on-brand and optimized for engagement.

  • Engagement Growth: Drive follower growth and community engagement through thoughtful posting, active interaction, and collaboration with influencers and partners.

  • Campaign Development: Work with marketing and creative teams to concept, launch, and measure campaigns that generate awareness and deepen loyalty.

  • Analytics & Reporting: Track performance, identify insights, and use data to refine strategies. Translate metrics into actionable recommendations for the team.

  • Trendspotting: Stay ahead of social and cultural trends, identifying opportunities to join conversations that align with our mission.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with Comms, HR, Product and Creative teams to ensure consistent messaging across all customer touchpoints.

  • Crisis Management: Monitor brand mentions and handle sensitive issues with care, ensuring Tin Can is represented thoughtfully in all online conversations.

What We’re Looking For

  • Social Media Expertise: You’ve managed social channels for a consumer-facing brand and understand the nuances of different platforms. You’re comfortable with short-form video (Reels, TikTok) creation and editing.

  • Community Builder: You have experience fostering online communities and know how to create meaningful connections between brand and audience.

  • Creative Storyteller: You bring ideas to life through compelling copy, visuals, and campaigns that drive conversation.

  • Analytical Mindset: You’re comfortable diving into analytics to understand performance and refine strategy.

  • Agility: You thrive in fast-moving environments, balancing daily posting with big-picture strategy.

  • Strong Communicator: You can embody the Tin Can voice with empathy, humor, and clarity.

  • Startup DNA: Comfortable moving fast, wearing multiple hats, and working with a small, mission-driven team.

Bonus Points

  • Experience growing social accounts for consumer hardware, kid/family brands, or mission-driven companies

Why Join Tin Can?

  • Impactful Storytelling: Be the voice that helps families around the world discover a better way to build meaningful connections.

  • Creative Ownership: Help build Tin Can’s social presence with the freedom to experiment and innovate.

  • Small Team, Big Vision: Work directly with the founders and marketing/creative leadership to shape strategy, content, and community.

  • Mission that Matters: Every kid should have the chance to grow up with more connection and less screen time.

 - Engagement Growth: Drive follower growth and community engagement through thoughtful posting, active interaction, and collaboration with influencers and partners.

 - Analytics & Reporting: Track performance, identify insights, and use data to refine strategies. Translate metrics into actionable recommendations for the team.

 - Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with Comms, HR, Product and Creative teams to ensure consistent messaging across all customer touchpoints.
   

 - Crisis Management: Monitor brand mentions and handle sensitive issues with care, ensuring Tin Can is represented thoughtfully in all online conversations.
   

What We’re Looking For

 - Community Builder: You have experience fostering online communities and know how to create meaningful connections between brand and audience.
   

 - Creative Storyteller: You bring ideas to life through compelling copy, visuals, and campaigns that drive conversation.
   

 - Analytical Mindset: You’re comfortable diving into analytics to understand performance and refine strategy.
   

 - Agility: You thrive in fast-moving environments, balancing daily posting with big-picture strategy.
   

 - Strong Communicator: You can embody the Tin Can voice with empathy, humor, and clarity.
   

 - Startup DNA: Comfortable moving fast, wearing multiple hats, and working with a small, mission-driven team.
   

Bonus Points

 - Experience growing social accounts for consumer hardware, kid/family brands, or mission-driven companies
   

Why Join Tin Can?

 - Impactful Storytelling: Be the voice that helps families around the world discover a better way to build meaningful connections.
   

 - Creative Ownership: Help build Tin Can’s social presence with the freedom to experiment and innovate.
   

 - Small Team, Big Vision: Work directly with the founders and marketing/creative leadership to shape strategy, content, and community.
   

 - Mission that Matters: Every kid should have the chance to grow up with more connection and less screen time.

jobs.title: Influencer Marketing Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Tin Can

At Tin Can, we're giving kids the freedom and social independence we had growing up —without smartphones. Our screen-free phone is a remix of the classic landline, built for today's world: private, safe, and fun. Parents get peace of mind, kids get autonomy.

Word of mouth has always been at the heart of Tin Can’s growth. From parents sharing with other parents to kids rallying their friends, our product spreads when people see and feel its impact. Influencers, creators, and brand partners are an extension of that community—trusted voices who can amplify our mission in authentic ways.

The Role

We’re looking for an Influencer Marketing Specialist to expand Tin Can’s reach by building relationships with creators, growing an affiliate program, and identifying brand partnerships that amplify our mission. This role blends relationship-building, strategy, and execution—you’ll identify and secure influencers, help manage partnerships, and craft campaigns that feel authentic and scalable.

You’ll be responsible for developing the programs and playbooks that allow Tin Can to leverage influencers and partners as a core growth channel. From micro-communities of parents to well-known creators and aligned brands, you’ll help Tin Can show up in ways that feel trusted, human, and culturally relevant. This role reports directly to the Head of Brand Strategy & Communications.

Key Responsibilities

  • Influencer Identification & Outreach: Research and identify creators and advocates whose values and audiences align with Tin Can. Build long-term relationships.

  • Affiliate Program Creation & Management: Design, launch, and grow an affiliate program that rewards advocates for driving awareness and sales. Manage recruitment, onboarding, tracking, and reporting.

  • Campaign Development: Co-create campaigns with influencers and partners that authentically showcase Tin Can and spark engagement across social and community channels.

  • Partnership Strategy: Identify and negotiate brand partnerships that help Tin Can expand its reach.

  • Program Management: With the support of the communications team, oversee influencer activations from start to finish—including contracts, creative briefs, timelines, and deliverables.

  • Measurement & Reporting: Track the success of influencer and partnership campaigns. Provide insights and recommendations for optimizing reach, engagement, and ROI.

  • Community Amplification: Collaborate with the social media team to amplify influencer content, repurpose posts, and maximize campaign visibility.

  • Trendspotting: Stay ahead of creator economy and affiliate marketing trends, identifying opportunities to experiment and innovate.

  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with other colleagues to ensure influencer and affiliate efforts align with overall brand goals and messaging.

What We’re Looking For

  • Influencer Marketing Experience: You’ve managed influencer programs (micro and macro) and understand what makes partnerships successful.

  • Affiliate Program Knowledge: Familiar with affiliate platforms, structures, and best practices for scaling referral-driven growth.

  • Relationship Builder: Skilled at connecting with people, building trust, and creating authentic long-term partnerships.

  • Creative Strategist: Able to develop compelling campaign ideas that feel natural to both the influencer and their audience.

  • Organized Operator: Strong project management skills with the ability to handle multiple campaigns and partnerships at once.

  • Data-Informed: Comfortable using metrics to evaluate performance, measure ROI, and iterate on strategy.

  • Startup DNA: Comfortable moving fast, wearing multiple hats, and working with a small, mission-driven team.

Bonus Points

  • Experience building influencer/affiliate programs for consumer hardware or family/parenting brands

  • Existing network of creators in the parenting, family, or lifestyle spaces

  • Experience negotiating contracts and managing budgets for influencer partnerships

  • Comfort producing or directing influencer content (video, photography, unboxing, etc.)

Why Join Tin Can?

  • Amplify a Movement: Help build a cultural conversation around kids, connection, and independence.

  • Creative Ownership: Shape and scale Tin Can’s influencer and partnership strategy from the ground up.

  • Small Team, Big Vision: Work closely with the marketing leadership to define a key growth channel.

  • Mission that Matters: Every kid should have the chance to grow up with more connection and less screen time.

jobs.title: Join our talent community!
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Tin Can

At Tin Can, we're giving kids the freedom and social independence we had growing up —without smartphones. Our screen-free phone is a remix of the classic landline, built for today's world: private, safe, and fun. Parents get peace of mind, kids get autonomy.

We’ve been featured on the Today Show, trusted by parents across the U.S., and backed by a growing community of believers.

Want to join us but don't see an open job relevant to your skillset? Apply here, and we'll keep your info handy for new openings.

jobs.title: Art Director
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Tin Can

At Tin Can, we're giving kids the freedom and social independence we had growing up —without smartphones. Our screen-free phone is a remix of the classic landline, built for today's world: private, safe, and fun. Parents get peace of mind, kids get autonomy.

We’ve been featured on the Today Show, trusted by parents across the U.S., and backed by a growing community of believers. Now we’re looking for an Art Director to shape how the world sees and feels Tin Can.

The Role

As the Art Director, you’ll be both the visionary and the doer—balancing high-level brand thinking with hands-on making. You’ll report directly to the Head of Brand Creative and help shape how Tin Can shows up in the world—rolling up your sleeves to design, produce, and bring ideas to life. From packaging and social content to events, influencer campaigns, brand collabs, and maybe even a custom ringtone (yep, really), your work will bring our analog-first spirit to life.

This is a role for someone who loves big ideas and tiny details—a conceptual thinker with design chops who can think strategically, collaborate cross-functionally, and also get in the weeds to make things look, feel, and work just right. You’ll thrive here if you’re energized by new challenges, learn fast, and believe that great design can make people feel connected, curious, and just a little more human. You’re also someone who’s excited to lend a hand to the team, even if it’s not in your job description—you’d be stoked to throw down on copy for a social post, provide feedback on new app features, or brainstorm how to better outfit the kid area in the office.

What You'll Do

Own the creative vision and design direction for Tin Can across all brand touch points.

  • Concept and execute projects from the big idea down to every pixel and post.

  • Design across mediums: digital, print, packaging, motion, events, and product.

  • Develop visual identities and design systems for new initiatives, products, and experiences.

  • Partner closely with Marketing, Product, and Community teams to ensure consistency and impact across channels.Translate brand strategy into creative campaigns that resonate with parents, kids, and broader communities.

  • Lead production across mediums, managing timelines, specs, and outside vendors. Anything from small, scrappy photoshoots in our office, to larger brand narrative films. You feel comfortable getting concepts over the finish line from pre to post production.

  • Bring creative ideas to unexpected spaces—whether that’s a custom ringtone, an event environment, or an interactive moment.

  • Maintain a high standard of design craft and brand consistency across all touchpoints.

  • Contribute to creative strategy, visual storytelling, and content development across channels:

    • Integrated brand campaigns

    • Social media and influencer marketing campaigns and brand collabs

    • Printed collateral, digital ads, and retail displays

    • Event setups and experiential branding

    • Packaging design and unboxing experiences

    • Website and app experience

  • Push the Tin Can brand forward while protecting its nostalgic, playful, and approachable core.

What We're Looking For

  • 5+ years of experience in brand design, art direction, or creative leadership roles.
    A portfolio that demonstrates both strategic thinking and executional craft—across digital, physical, and experiential projects.

  • You’re organized and proactive, able to manage your own time and juggle multiple projects in a fast-moving startup environment—where priorities shift and creative solutions evolve quickly.

  • You’re an expert at ideation and get excited to problem solve against multiple different solutions and approaches.

  • Fluency in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, and/or other design tools.

  • Strong understanding of brand systems, typography, packaging, and visual storytelling.

  • You can confidently present work, incorporating feedback while advocating for strong creative solutions.

  • A builder’s mindset: you can work scrappy, move fast, and scale as we grow.

  • A love for creating work that’s playful, human, and a little bit nostalgic. Curiosity, humor, and the ability to make things happen even when the brief isn’t fully written.

  • Bonus points for: skills in photography, motion, animation, or light video editing.

Why Join Tin Can

You’ll be joining a team that’s small, scrappy, and growing fast. Your fingerprints will be all over how the world experiences Tin Can—from the box someone opens, to the booth they wander into, to the campaign that makes them grin.

If you’re excited about designing for a brand with heart, humor, and a twirly cord or two, this might just be your call.

This is a role for someone who loves big ideas and tiny details—a conceptual thinker with design chops who can think strategically, collaborate cross-functionally, and also get in the weeds to make things look, feel, and work just right. You’ll thrive here if you’re energized by new challenges, learn fast, and believe that great design can make people feel connected, curious, and just a little more human. You’re also someone who’s excited to lend a hand to the team, even if it’s not in your job description—you’d be stoked to throw down on copy for a social post, provide feedback on new app features, or brainstorm how to better outfit the kid area in the office.




What You'll Do

Own the creative vision and design direction for Tin Can across all brand touch points.

 - Concept and execute projects from the big idea down to every pixel and post.

 - Design across mediums: digital, print, packaging, motion, events, and product.

 - Develop visual identities and design systems for new initiatives, products, and experiences.

 - Partner closely with Marketing, Product, and Community teams to ensure consistency and impact across channels.Translate brand strategy into creative campaigns that resonate with parents, kids, and broader communities.

 - Lead production across mediums, managing timelines, specs, and outside vendors. Anything from small, scrappy photoshoots in our office, to larger brand narrative films. You feel comfortable getting concepts over the finish line from pre to post production.

 - Bring creative ideas to unexpected spaces—whether that’s a custom ringtone, an event environment, or an interactive moment.

 - Maintain a high standard of design craft and brand consistency across all touchpoints.

 - Contribute to creative strategy, visual storytelling, and content development across channels:
   
   - Integrated brand campaigns
   
   - Social media and influencer marketing campaigns and brand collabs
   
   - Printed collateral, digital ads, and retail displays
   
   - Event setups and experiential branding
   
   - Packaging design and unboxing experiences
   
   - Website and app experience

 - Push the Tin Can brand forward while protecting its nostalgic, playful, and approachable core.

What We're Looking For

 - 5+ years of experience in brand design, art direction, or creative leadership roles.
   A portfolio that demonstrates both strategic thinking and executional craft—across digital, physical, and experiential projects.

 - You’re organized and proactive, able to manage your own time and juggle multiple projects in a fast-moving startup environment—where priorities shift and creative solutions evolve quickly.

 - You’re an expert at ideation and get excited to problem solve against multiple different solutions and approaches.

 - Fluency in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, and/or other design tools.

 - Strong understanding of brand systems, typography, packaging, and visual storytelling.

 - You can confidently present work, incorporating feedback while advocating for strong creative solutions.

 - A builder’s mindset: you can work scrappy, move fast, and scale as we grow.

 - A love for creating work that’s playful, human, and a little bit nostalgic. Curiosity, humor, and the ability to make things happen even when the brief isn’t fully written.

 - Bonus points for: skills in photography, motion, animation, or light video editing.

Why Join Tin Can

You’ll be joining a team that’s small, scrappy, and growing fast. Your fingerprints will be all over how the world experiences Tin Can—from the box someone opens, to the booth they wander into, to the campaign that makes them grin.

If you’re excited about designing for a brand with heart, humor, and a twirly cord or two, this might just be your call.

jobs.title: Head of International Expansion
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Tin Can

At Tin Can, we're giving kids the freedom and social independence we had growing up—without smartphones. Our screen-free phone is a remix of the classic landline, built for today's world: private, safe, and fun. Parents get peace of mind, kids get autonomy.

We've launched in the U.S. and the response has been overwhelming. Every single day we hear from parents around the globe who want Tin Can for their kids. Our vision is bold and urgent: to give kids everywhere the chance to grow up connected, confident, and screen-free.

The Role

We're looking for a Head of International Expansion to lead Tin Can's next chapter: bringing our product to families across the world. This is a highly entrepreneurial, GM-style role working out of our Seattle office four days a week with Friday being optionally remote.

You'll wear many hats—evaluating which markets to enter first, setting up local operations, ensuring compliance, shaping go-to-market strategies, and ultimately building the playbook to scale Tin Can country by country.

You'll be our architect for global growth, working directly with the founding team to decide the right country model, validate assumptions quickly, and translate early wins into repeatable strategies.

A major part of this role will involve compliance. As we expand, you'll be responsible for navigating complex legal and regulatory landscapes. You'll identify compliance requirements in each market, find and work with local legal experts, and ensure that Tin Can can launch in a way that meets all relevant regulations.

If the idea of building Tin Can into a global household name excites you—and you thrive on figuring out messy, high-stakes problems—this is your role.

Key Responsibilities

  • Market Prioritization: Research, evaluate, and recommend which country Tin Can should enter first.

  • Country Launches – Lead end-to-end setup of new markets, including compliance, legal, fulfillment, distribution, and customer support.

  • Compliance & Regulatory Navigation: Identify key regulatory requirements in each market (e.g., telecom/VoIP, consumer safety, data privacy). Partner with legal teams to ensure Tin Can launches in full compliance.

  • Growth & Marketing: Develop local go-to-market strategies and creative campaigns that make Tin Can resonate culturally and spread virally.

  • Country Model Design: Work with founders to test and refine the right expansion approach (direct-to-consumer, partnerships, distributors, etc.).

  • Playbook Creation: Use the first international market as a testing ground to create a repeatable expansion playbook for future countries.

  • Cross-functional Leadership: Partner closely with product, ops, and marketing to ensure smooth global operations and a unified customer experience.

  • Entrepreneurial Ownership: Operate like a founder in new markets, making the calls needed to succeed.

What We're Looking For

  • International Growth Experience: You've led expansion efforts into new countries and understand the complexity of compliance, logistics, and local adaptation.

  • GM Mentality: You think holistically about the business—P&L, growth, customer experience—and are comfortable owning results end to end.

  • Entrepreneurial Builder: You thrive in ambiguity, roll up your sleeves, and figure things out fast.

  • Strategic & Scrappy: Equally capable of running a high-level strategy session and negotiating with a local fulfillment partner.

  • Global Mindset: You understand cultural nuance and how to adapt products and marketing to different markets.

  • Startup DNA: Comfortable moving fast, wearing multiple hats, and working with a small, mission-driven team.

Bonus Points

  • Experience expanding consumer hardware or subscription businesses internationally

  • Familiarity with compliance for communications/VoIP products

  • Multilingual background or time spent living/working abroad

Why Join Tin Can?

  • Global Impact: Help shape a product that could define how kids around the world connect in healthier ways.

  • Autonomy & Ownership: This is a greenfield role with massive scope. You'll be building Tin Can's global future from scratch.

  • Small Team, Big Vision: Work directly with the founders to shape not just strategy, but culture and brand on an international scale.

  • Mission that Matters: Every kid should have the chance to grow up with more connection and less screen time.

 - Small Team, Big Vision: Work directly with the founders to shape not just strategy, but culture and brand on an international scale.

 - Mission that Matters: Every kid should have the chance to grow up with more connection and less screen time.

jobs.title: Customer Experience Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Tin Can

Here at Tin Can, we’re working to give kids the social independence we had growing up—without smartphones. We’ve built a remix of the classic home phone we had when we were young, but on a totally private network and with a bunch of added safety functionality (plus some fun surprise features in the pipeline).

We’re building a bold, authentic, nostalgic, and kinda quirky brand that resonates with folks who want something simpler & better for their kids than the tech-infused lives we’re currently living (and who have a sense of humor about it). And now, as we prepare to scale our flagship product to tens of thousands of households, we’re looking for two Customer Experience Specialists to make every interaction with Tin Can feel like a warm hug and a high-five.

The Role

This is no ordinary support job. You'll be laying the groundwork for how we talk to, care for, and cheer on the amazing families who choose to trust us with their kids' communication.

Reporting to our Head of Customer Experience & Community Growth (who, yes, still remembers their childhood landline number), you’ll be the friendly face (well—text and voice!) of Tin Can. Whether it’s troubleshooting a hiccup, answering a question, or just making someone’s day, you’ll help set the tone for what kind, thoughtful, and human-centered support feels like.

And because we believe that customer experience is about more than tickets, you’ll also help shape community, connection, and trust with every message you send.


Key Responsibilities

You’ll help our customers feel heard, supported, and delighted from day one. Here’s what you’ll do:

  • Own our support inboxes (email, text, Instagram DMs, and the occasional phone call from a curious grandparent). Respond with warmth, clarity, and lightning-speed kindness.

  • Keep our KPIs in tip-top shape, like average first response time and CSAT—but also help us define what great support really looks like in a mission-driven, family-first company.

  • Write and maintain our response templates so they sound like Tin Can: human, helpful, and never robotic.

  • Help organize our tagging system to track trends, spot product bugs, and share smart insights with the team

  • Be the voice of the customer—helping product, ops, and marketing teams understand what families are really saying

  • Make it feel personal: whether it's solving a problem or celebrating a kid's first solo call, you're making moments happen every day that customers (or potential customers!) will remember

A Day in the Life

  • Most of your day will be spent in our inboxes—being a calm, kind, and capable presence for our customers.

  • You might be helping a parent activate a new device, updating a shipping status, or gently explaining why a dog can’t be added to the contact list (yet).

  • You’ll also support a few daily manual workflows, and over time, help us automate the stuff that shouldn’t require a human touch.

  • You’ll work closely with our whole team—we’re tiny and tight-knit—so whether something’s broken, confusing, or delightful, we want to hear about it.

What We’re Looking For

We’re not hung up on resumes—we care more about voice, empathy, and a knack for solving problems with curiosity and excitement.
.
You might be perfect for this role if:

  • You’re a phenomenal writer—clear, warm, and friendly (with a great understanding of when to infuse humor into an interaction!)

  • You have experience helping people (whether at a retail counter, call center, or even camp counselor gig)

  • You’re organized, thoughtful, and calm under pressure

  • You’re a self-starter who loves building things from scratch—and maybe even making them fun

  • You’re curious and down to learn new tools (Front, Instagram, G-Suite, Slack, Notion)

  • You’re not afraid to say, “I don’t know, but I’ll find out.”

  • Bonus: You still remember what your childhood phone looked like ;)

Why Join Tin Can?

  • Mission: We’re on a quest to give kids a more analog childhood—one with real conversations, real connection, and way less screen time. No doomscrolling, data mining, or dopamine traps—just a simpler, better way for kids to stay in touch. This is a rare chance to be a part of building something that truly matters—reshaping the way kids connect in a world that desperately needs it.

  • Real impact: Your work will directly shape the way customers feel cared for by Tin Can.

  • Startup magic: We're early, we're scrappy, and we get to build things the right way, fast!

  • Small team, big support: We're five people who really like working together—and we can't wait to add a sixth.

  • Creative freedom: Got a better way to do something? Try it. No red tape, no weird corporate layers.
